actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department.
Subcommittee on Taxation and Debt Management. Hearings held.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Taxation and Debt Management

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to limit the deduction of living expenses by members of Congress and to require substantiation of such living expenses.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to limit to $6,000 the amount of living expenses which Members of Congress may deduct from their incomes. Repeals the provision allowing such tax deduction without substantiation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to limit the deduction of living expenses by members of Congress and to require substantiation of such living expenses.
